intro: Spergula rubra subsp. radicans, commonly known as red sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves and produces flowering stems that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in nutrient-poor, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine and tundra ecosystems.
